story:
Once upon a time, in a small village in rural China, there lived a kind and curious little boy named Li Mei. Li Mei's greatest joy in life was exploring the beautiful countryside and discovering the wonders of nature.

One day, while Li Mei was walking through the woods, he came across a mysterious old man sitting by a stream. The old man was dressed in flowing robes and had a long white beard that reached down to his waist.

Li Mei approached the old man cautiously and asked him who he was. The old man smiled and introduced himself as the Spirit of the River.

"I have been watching you, Li Mei," said the Spirit of the River. "I know of your love for nature and your desire to learn all there is to know about the world around you. That is why I have come to you today."

Li Mei's eyes widened with excitement. He had always dreamed of having an adventure and learning all there was to know about the world.

"I will grant you one wish, young Li Mei," said the Spirit of the River. "Ask for anything your heart desires, and I will make it come true."

Li Mei thought for a moment, and then he had an idea. "I wish to travel the world and learn all there is to know about every culture and every land," he said.

The Spirit of the River smiled and nodded. "Very well," he said. "I will grant your wish, but there is a price to be paid. Are you willing to pay it?"

Li Mei nodded eagerly. "Yes, anything!" he said.

"Very well," said the Spirit of the River. "From this day forth, you will be able to travel to any place in the world you desire, simply by closing your eyes and wishing yourself there. But in return, you must promise to use your knowledge and your experiences to help others and make the world a better place."

Li Mei agreed without hesitation, and with a wave of the Spirit of the River's hand, he was whisked away to a far-off land.

Over the next few years, Li Mei traveled the world, learning about different cultures and meeting new people. He studied languages, history, and science, and he used his knowledge to help those in need.

Eventually, Li Mei returned home to his village, where he became a respected teacher and leader. He shared his stories and his wisdom with the people of his village, and they flourished under his guidance.

And so, Li Mei lived a long and happy life, always remembering the lessons he had learned on his adventures and using them to make the world a better place.

The end.

Good night, my dear son, I hope you enjoyed the story and have a good sleep. Remember to always be curious and kind, just like Li Mei, and you will go far in life.
